Series IV: Pamphlets and Publications, 1829-1941, n.d.
American Institute of the City of New York for the Encouragement of Science and Invention records
American Institute of the City of New York for the Encouragement of Science and Invention records
Subseries 1: American Institute Pamphles and Publications, 1829-1941
Subseries 1: American Institute Pamphles and Publications, 1829-1941

This subseries contains publications of the American Institute. These include the nineteenth century Journal of the American Institute (Vol. I-IV, 1835-1839); Annual Fair publications (i.e., premium lists); printed addresses on topics such as agriculture, gardening, sanitation; and annual reports and proceedings. In addition, material from the 1890s concerns photography and the American Institute's photographic salon. Bound Transactions of the American Institute cover the years 1847 to 1872.

Twentieth century material includes annual reports, items related to the annual fairs, and material from 1930s Children's Fairs and Salons of Photography. American Institute publications for children and young adults include Science Leaflet (Jan. 4, 1934; Sept. 14, 1939-May 8, 1941), Amateur Scientist (May 1937-March 1938), Science Observer (Dec. 1938-July 1941), and March of Science (Sept. 17, 1932-Feb. 23, 1937).
